feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 3:53PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM EXPECTED TO IMPACT THE SUSITNA VALLEY MONDAY... Snow is expected to develop Monday morning across much of the Susitna Valley. The snow is expected to start off as wet snow before transitioning to a drier, more powdery snow by Monday afternoon or evening. Snowfall rates are also expected to increase late Monday, especially for Talkeetna south to Willow (including

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 19 at 3:44PM AKST until December 20 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 9 PM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain mixed with snow occasionally. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. Highest snow amounts from Sterling east. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula.

entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches possible. Lighter snow amounts for Gustavus and Hoonah regions. Higher snow totals for Juneau, Petersburg, and Wrangell.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 4:06AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated water levels along the West Coast Sunday and Monday... A strong weather system moving to the West Coast will bring elevated water levels to the coast south of the Bering Strait Sunday night and Monday and north of the Bering Strait on Monday. Water levels are expected to be 3 to 6 feet above the normal high tide line. Water levels will be similar to the system that brought
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued December 19 at 2:02PM PST until December 26 at 4:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Multiple Winter Storms to Impact Holiday Mountain Travel Tuesday through the Weekend... .A series of winter storms will bring multiple rounds of moderate to heavy mountain snow and gusty winds Tuesday through Sunday. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 2:26AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STORMY WEATHER RETURNS WITH TRAVEL IMPACTS STARTING TUESDAY, LIKELY EXTENDING THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE YEAR.... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada next week. There will be few, if any, meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin on Tuesday, so plan ahead.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 2:26AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STORMY WEATHER RETURNS WITH TRAVEL IMPACTS STARTING TUESDAY, LIKELY EXTENDING THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE YEAR.... A series of Pacific winter storms will bring periods of stormy weather to much of California and Nevada next week. There will be few, if any, meaningful breaks in the weather for the Sierra once the storms begin on Tuesday, so plan ahead.

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued December 19 at 1:57PM MST until December 19 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 MPH with gusts up to 60 MPH possible. * WHERE...Central Laramie Range including Bordeaux along Interstate 25 between Chugwater and Wheatland.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued December 19 at 1:57PM MST until December 19 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West to southwest winds 35 to 45 MPH with gusts up to 60 MPH possible. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain along Interstate 80 between Laramie and Rawlins.
